name: Hilton Warsaw Hotel and Convention Centre

reviews.text: Even though I booked my room well in advance (5 months prior to my stay), I got an unpleasant surprise when I arrived, because due to a conference the hotel was fully booked and there was only a smoking room for me. I refused that, because I detest smoking rooms, as do most of the business travellers I know.
reviews.title: OK hotel but not such a great welcome

reviews.text: After a hassle and telling the people at the desk that this is unacceptable, and that I am a Hilton Honors Gold member (even though I hate using that as a means sof pressure) they found a non smoking room for me on a lower floor, even though I made a reservation for an executive room on a top floors. The room was still OK, but I will look carefully at what they will charge me when i leave the hotel in two days. I must say it did spoil my stay a bit.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Modern lobby, check-in/check-out very efficient, knowledgeable concierge and good set of high quality tourist handouts. Spacious rooms, with great views and very good condiments (tea, coffee, etc.). Welcome gift for HHonors members + free bottled water every day! If you get access to the Executive Lounge - breakfasts are awesome, there is an open bar, great place to relax. Money saving tip: in a building next door, there is a 2nd day laundry - "Pralnia Buczynscy" www.pralniabuczynscy.pl. This hotel is a bit further from the town's center than some others, but it's next door to the most important museum in Warsaw - Museum of the Warsaw Uprising, so make sure to visit it during your stay.
reviews.title: Warm welcome for an unexpected stay

reviews.text: We had not expected to stay here as we were actually guests at our favorite hotel, the Intercontinental, which is by Warsaw main railway station (Centralny) but at 23.00 on 9 September we were awoken by the news there had been a bomb alert requiring us to evacuate the hotel. We were bussed the short distance to the Hilton where, at midnight, they coped well with us "refugees" from the Intercontinental. We were quickly allocated 2503 on the top floor. We did not get much sleep but no fault of the Hilton who provided a big bed and a large duvet. The bathroom was well equipped, with a walkin shower as well as traditional bath.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.text: We had breakfast in the well laid out ground floor restaurant.(food better displayed than in the Intercontinental) before being picked up and taken back to the IC.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: Had decided to treat myself and stayed two night in August 2012 in a King Hilton Deluxe Plus room. Wonderfull room with separate shower and tub. Could have skipped the Plus thing since I was I no need of a working area in the room but the price difference is next to nothing. Impeccable service at reception and in bar and restaurant. Hotel is almost next to new occupation museum but to far from city center to walk. Taxi to center is only about 20 zl. What else is there to criticize? A hotel like this is stylish - not cozy. Parking is to expensive 100 zl/night. I parked in the street without paying without any problems. Carpet in room I stayed had some stains but was otherwise very clean. Prices in restaurant and bar is a lot higher then in the city in general (but quality and service is very good), The provided slippers and bathrobe are to small for me. There is nowhere to smoke indoors unless you get a smoking room, and I would imagine it will quite cold smoking outside on the terrace in the winter. However my biggest complaint was that the channels on the TV in the bedroom are different from the channels on the TV in the bathroom. Having lowered my body into the bathtub preparing to relax with a gin and tonic I found to my horror that most of the channels in the bathroom were German or Polish. But if this was my biggest concern then hotel can't be half bad and I am longing to return.
reviews.title: Extremely nice but not without its faults
